name.description: The name of the Elasticsearch service instance

service_account_secret.description: Name of the Secret Store credentials to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed.

user.description: The user that runs the Elasticsearch services and owns the Mesos sandbox.

service_account.description: The service account for DC/OS service authentication. This is typically left empty to use the default unless service authentication is needed. The value given here is passed as the principal of Mesos framework.

virtual_network_name.description: The name of the virtual network to join

virtual_network_plugin_labels.description: Labels to pass to the virtual network plugin. Comma-separated key:value pairs. For example: k_0:v_0,k_1:v_1,...,k_n:v_n

mesos_api_version.description: Configures the Mesos API version to use. Possible values: V0 (non-HTTP), V1 (HTTP)

tls.description: Enable TLS support (requires Enterprise DC/OS running in strict or permissive security mode).

log_level.description: The log level for the DC/OS service.

master_nodes.description: Configuration properties for the three (3) Elasticsearch master nodes

heap.description: The Elasticsearch process JVM heap configuration object

size.description: The amount of JVM heap, in MB, allocated to the Elasticsearch node process.

disk.description: Node disk requirements (only respected with persistent volumes)

disk_type.description: Disk type to be used for storing data. [ROOT, MOUNT]

transport_port.description: Transport port for master nodes to listen on.

count.description: Number of data nodes to run

heap.description: The Elasticsearch process JVM heap configuration object

size.description: The amount of JVM heap, in MB, allocated to the Elasticsearch node process.

disk.description: Node disk requirements (only respected with persistent volumes)

disk_type.description: Disk type to be used for storing data. [ROOT, MOUNT]

count.description: Number of ingest nodes to run

heap.description: The Elasticsearch process JVM heap configuration object

size.description: The amount of JVM heap, in MB, allocated to the Elasticsearch node process.

disk.description: Node disk requirements (only respected with persistent volumes)

disk_type.description: Disk type to be used for storing data. [ROOT, MOUNT]

count.description: Number of coordinator nodes to run

heap.description: The Elasticsearch process JVM heap configuration object

size.description: The amount of JVM heap, in MB, allocated to the Elasticsearch node process.

disk.description: Node disk requirements (only respected with persistent volumes)

disk_type.description: Disk type to be used for storing data. [ROOT, MOUNT]

xpack_enabled.description: Whether or not to enable the commercial X-Pack plugin from Elastic

plugins.description: Comma-separated list of plugins to install

health_user.description: Elastic username to use for X-Pack authentication, if enabled

health_user_password.description: Password to use with health_user for X-Pack authentication, if enabled. Note that you are not setting the password here. You are telling the framework the credentials to use when sending in health check requests.

gateway_recover_after_time.description: If the expected number of nodes is not achieved, the recovery process waits for the configured amount of time before trying to recover regardless. Defaults to 5m if one of the expected_nodes settings is configured.

script_allowed_types.description: By default all script types (inline,file,stored) are allowed to be executed. This can be modified using the setting script_allowed_types. Only the types specified as part of the setting will be allowed to be executed. To specify no types are allowed, set script.allowed_types to be none. Empty string "" means all types (default).

script_allowed_contexts.description: By default all script contexts (search,update,aggs,plugin) are allowed to be executed. This can be modified using the setting script_allowed_contexts. Only the contexts specified as part of the setting will be allowed to be executed. To specify no contexts are allowed, set script_allowed_contexts to be none. Empty string "" means all contexts (default).

repositories_url_allowed_urls.description: URL Repository supports the following protocols: "http", "https", "ftp", "file" and "jar". URL repositories with http:, https:, and ftp: URLs has to be whitelisted by specifying allowed URLs in the repositories_url_allowed_urls setting. This setting supports wildcards in the place of host, path, query, and fragment.

network_tcp_no_delay.description: Enable or disable the TCP no delay setting. Defaults to true.

network_tcp_keep_alive.description: Enable or disable TCP keep alive. Defaults to true.

network_tcp_reuse_address.description: Should an address be reused or not. Defaults to true.

network_tcp_send_buffer_size.description: The size of the TCP send buffer (specified with size units). By default not explicitly set.

network_tcp_receive_buffer_size.description: The size of the TCP receive buffer (specified with size units). By default not explicitly set.

transport_tcp_connect_timeout.description: The socket connect timeout setting (in time setting format). Defaults to 30s.

transport_tcp_compress.description: Set to true to enable compression (LZF) between all nodes. Defaults to false.

transport_ping_schedule.description: Schedule a regular ping message to ensure that connections are kept alive. Defaults to 5s in the transport client and -1 (disabled) elsewhere.

http_enabled.description: The http module can be completely disabled and not started by setting http.enabled to false. Default is true.

http_max_content_length.description: The max content of an HTTP request. Defaults to 100mb. If set to greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE, it will be reset to 100mb.

http_max_initial_line_length.description: The max length of an HTTP URL. Defaults to 4kb.

http_max_header_size.description: The max size of allowed headers. Defaults to 8kB.

http_compression.description: Support for compression when possible (with Accept-Encoding). Defaults to true.

http_compression_level.description: Defines the compression level to use for HTTP responses. Valid values are in the range of 1 (minimum compression) and 9 (maximum compression). Defaults to 3.

http_cors_enabled.description: Enable or disable cross-origin resource sharing, i.e. whether a browser on another origin can execute requests against Elasticsearch. Set to true to enable Elasticsearch to process pre-flight CORS requests.

http_cors_allow_origin.description: Which origins to allow. Defaults to no origins allowed. If you prepend and append a / to the value, this will be treated as a regular expression, allowing you to support HTTP and HTTPs. * is a valid value but is considered a security risk as your elasticsearch instance is open to cross origin requests from anywhere.

http_cors_max_age.description: Browsers send a "preflight" OPTIONS-request to determine CORS settings. Defines how long the result should be cached for. Defaults to 1728000 (20 days)

http_cors_allow_credentials.description: Whether the Access-Control-Allow-Credentials header should be returned. Note: This header is only returned when the setting is set to true. Defaults to false.

http_cors_allow_headers.description: Which headers to allow. Defaults to X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Content-Length.

http_cors_allow_methods.description: Which methods to allow. Defaults to OPTIONS, HEAD, GET, POST, PUT, DELETE.

http_detailed_errors_enabled.description: Enables or disables the output of detailed error messages and stack traces in response output. Note: When set to false and the error_trace request parameter is specified, an error will be returned; when error_trace is not specified, a simple message will be returned. Defaults to true.

http_pipelining.description: Enable or disable HTTP pipelining, defaults to true.

http_pipelining_max_events.description: The maximum number of events to be queued up in memory before a HTTP connection is closed, defaults to 10000.

http_content_type_required.description: Enables or disables strict checking and usage of the Content-Type header for all requests with content, defaults to false.

thread_pool_search_size.description: For count/search/suggest operations. Thread pool type is fixed with a size of int((# of available_processors * 3) / 2) + 1. Empty means do not explicity set.

thread_pool_search_queue_size.description: For count/search/suggest operations. The queue_size allows to control the size of the queue of pending requests that have no threads to execute them. -1 means its unbounded. Defaults to 1000

thread_pool_index_size.description: For index/delete operations. Thread pool type is fixed with a size of # of available processors. The size parameter controls the number of threads. Empty means do not explicity set.

thread_pool_index_queue_size.description: For index/delete operations. The queue_size allows to control the size of the queue of pending requests that have no threads to execute them.  -1 means its unbounded. Defaults to 200.

thread_pool_get_size.description: For get operations. Thread pool type is fixed with a size of # of available processors. The size parameter controls the number of threads. Empty means do not explicity set.

thread_pool_get_queue_size.description: For get operations. The queue_size allows to control the size of the queue of pending requests that have no threads to execute them.  -1 means its unbounded. Defaults to 1000.

thread_pool_bulk_size.description: For bulk operations. Thread pool type is fixed with a size of # of available processors. The size parameter controls the number of threads. Empty means do not explicity set.

thread_pool_bulk_queue_size.description: For bulk operations. The queue_size allows to control the size of the queue of pending requests that have no threads to execute them.  -1 means its unbounded. Defaults to 1000.

thread_pool_warmer_core.description: For segment warm-up operations. The scaling thread pool holds a dynamic number of threads. This number is proportional to the workload and varies between the value of the core and max parameters. Empty means do not explicity set.

thread_pool_warmer_max.description: For segment warm-up operations. The scaling thread pool holds a dynamic number of threads. This number is proportional to the workload and varies between the value of the core and max parameters. Empty means do not explicity set.

thread_pool_warmer_keep_alive.description: For segment warm-up operations. The keep_alive parameter determines how long a thread should be kept around in the thread pool without it doing any work.

thread_pool_refresh_core.description: For refresh operations. The scaling thread pool holds a dynamic number of threads. This number is proportional to the workload and varies between the value of the core and max parameters. Empty means do not explicity set.

thread_pool_refresh_max.description: For refresh operations. The scaling thread pool holds a dynamic number of threads. This number is proportional to the workload and varies between the value of the core and max parameters. Empty means do not explicity set.

thread_pool_refresh_keep_alive.description: For refresh operations. The keep_alive parameter determines how long a thread should be kept around in the thread pool without it doing any work.

thread_pool_generic_core.description: For generic operations (e.g., background node discovery). The scaling thread pool holds a dynamic number of threads. This number is proportional to the workload and varies between the value of the core and max parameters. Empty means do not explicity set.

thread_pool_generic_max.description: For generic operations (e.g., background node discovery). The scaling thread pool holds a dynamic number of threads. This number is proportional to the workload and varies between the value of the core and max parameters. Empty means do not explicity set.

thread_pool_generic_keep_alive.description: For generic operations (e.g., background node discovery). The keep_alive parameter determines how long a thread should be kept around in the thread pool without it doing any work.
